com.quest.glue.api.services
Interface CredentialQuery2

public interface CredentialQuery2

CredentialQuery defines a set of parameters that can be used to query for Credentials on the FMS. CredentialQuery objects can be cached for later use.

Since:
5.5.5.5

Method Detail

addProperty

void addProperty(java.lang.String name,
                 java.lang.String value)
Adds extra query parameters.

Possible names and value of the extra query parameters are specific to the purpose of the required credentials. Refer to server documentation for details.

Parameters:
name - Property value name
value - Properties value

addType

void addType(java.lang.String type)
Adds a desired credential type. If several types are specified they will be combined using the logical OR operation.

Parameters:
type - of credential

setSourceAddress

void setSourceAddress(java.net.InetAddress address)
Sets the address of the host from where a connection to the target resource will be attempted.

If both the source host name and source address are set both of them will be considered during query execution.

Parameters:
address - of remote host

setSourceHost

void setSourceHost(java.lang.String host)
Sets the name of the host from where a connection to the target resource will be attempted.

The host name does not have to be in its canonical form by the actual format of the name may affect how the query is executed. The server will not resolve this name to a host address.

If both the source host name and setSourceAddress(java.net.InetAddress) source address} are set both of them will be considered during query execution, however the value set through this method will override InetAddress.getHostName().

Parameters:
host - to connect from

setTargetAddress

void setTargetAddress(java.net.InetAddress address)
Sets the address the resource that requires access credentials

If both the target host name and target address are set both of them will be considered during query execution.

Parameters:
address - ip address of target host

setTargetHost

void setTargetHost(java.lang.String host)
Sets the name of the host of the resource that requires access credentials.

The host name does not have to be in its canonical form by the actual format of the name may affect how the query is executed. The server will not resolve this name to a host address.

If both the target host name and target address are set both of them will be considered during query execution, however the value set through this method will override InetAddress.getHostName().

Parameters:
host - target host

setTargetPort

void setTargetPort(int port)
Sets the port that is intended to be used to access the resource that requires access credentials

Parameters:
port - on host
